comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
I am trying to use the import wizard from File>Import>General>Existing
Projects into Workspace.
I then select the root directory to be the c:\ directory and click enter.
It seems that the c:\ directory might be too big of a search area.

The projects I know exist in c:\ doesn't show up in my Projects list and I get
the error pasted below listed in my Error Log.

I'm using Windows 2000 with eclipse 3.2 and java 1.6.
I have tried this with other older version of eclipse and java as well as on
Linux and the result is the same.

More information:
Could this be an issue of the directory scanner finding a file type that it doesn't like?  or that the directory structure is too deep?  or Eclipse runs out of memory?

The import window appears to search the c directory for about 30 seconds to a minute and then just stops and appears blank.
If I go to the directory I know that the .project file appears my projects do appear able to import.

We tried to get around this bug by using team sets but encountered other bugs.  Perhaps with the clearcase plugin.
This doesn't appear to be related to AJDT. Passing over to Platform.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 154537 ***
